6241.quoteText: We also don't want your personal information for any longer than we need it, so we only keep it long enough to do what we collected it for. Once we don't need it, we take steps to destroy it unless we are required by law to keep it longer.
6241.title: The service's data retention period is kept to the minimum necessary for fulfilling its purposes

tosdr.case: The service's data retention period is kept to the minimum necessary for fulfilling its purposes

6242.quoteText:
We may need to change this policy and our notices.
The updates will be posted online.
If the changes are substantive, we will announce the update through Mozilla's usual channels for such announcements such as blog posts and forums.
6242.title: The service may change its terms at any time, but the user will receive notification of the changes.

tosdr.case: The service may change its terms at any time, but the user will receive notification of the changes.

6308.quoteText:
When the law requires it.
We follow the law whenever we receive requests about you from a government or related to a lawsuit.
We'll notify you when we're asked to hand over your personal information in this way unless we're legally prohibited from doing so.
6308.title: The service promises to inform and/or notify users regarding government inquiries that may involve users' personal data

tosdr.case: The service promises to inform and/or notify users regarding government inquiries that may involve users' personal data

6309.quoteText: When we receive requests like this, we'll only release your personal information if we have a good faith belief that the law requires us to do so. Nothing in this policy is intended to limit any legal defenses or objections that you may have to a third party's request to disclose your information.
6309.title: The service is transparent regarding government requests or inquiries that may involve user data.

tosdr.case: The service is transparent regarding government requests or inquiries that may involve user data.

6310.quoteText: • If our organizational structure or status changes (if we undergo a restructuring, are acquired, or go bankrupt) we may pass your information to a successor or affiliate.
6310.title: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.

tosdr.case: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.

6313.quoteText: If you have configured your browser to send a “Do Not Track” signal when accessing our websites, Mozilla will not utilize any of the tools described in the Metrics section.
6313.title: This service respects your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) headers

tosdr.case: This service respects your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) headers

6314.quoteText:
Note that certain features of our products and services may not function properly without the aid of cookies.
</p
6314.title: Blocking cookies may limit your ability to use the service

tosdr.case: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service

6315.quoteText: You can control individual cookie preferences, indicate your cookie preferences to others, and opt-out of web analytics and optimization tools.
6315.title: This service employs third-party cookies, but with opt-out instructions

tosdr.case: This service employs third-party cookies, but with opt-out instructions

8379.quoteText: Despite our efforts, if we learn of a security breach, we'll notify you so that you can take appropriate protective steps.
8379.title: The services will notify users if personal data has been affected by data breaches

tosdr.case: The services will notify users if personal data has been affected by data breaches

When we receive requests like this, we'll only release your personal information if we have a good faith belief that the law requires us to do so.'

9125.title: There is a date of the last update of the terms

tosdr.tldr: Located right under 'Mozilla Privacy Policy' headline at the top of the page.

9126.title: The service provides details about what kinds of personal information they collect

tosdr.case: The service provides details about what kinds of personal information they collect
tosdr.tldr:
Stated under the headline 'How do we learn information about you?'
We learn information about you when:

• you give it to us directly (e.g., when you choose to send us crash reports);
• we collect it automatically through our products and services (e.g., when your Firefox browser checks with us to see if is up to date);
• someone else tells us information about you (e.g., when Thunderbird works with your email providers to set up your account); or
• when we try and understand more about you based on information you've given to us (e.g., when we use your IP address to customize language for some of our services).

Last edited
9 April 2020

9127.title: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data

tosdr.case: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data
tosdr.tldr:
Stated under headline 'What do we do with your information once we have it?'

'When you give us information, we will use it in the ways for which you've given us permission. Generally, we use your information to help us provide and improve our products and services for you.'

9 April 2020
